title.narrative: Bangladesh Disability and Children at Risk

description.narrative: To expand coverage and improve quality of services for persons with disabilities and children at risk by strengthening and scaling up government service delivery systems.

participating-org.narrative: Economic Relations Division, Ministry of Finance

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. A. 1 | Description :Establish a National Steering Committee (NSC) | Due Date :31-Aug-2008

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. A. 2 | Description :Establish and maintain until completion of the Project a ProjectImplementation Unit with members acceptable to the Association. | Due Date :31-Dec-2008

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II. A. 1(a) | Description :Prepare project progress report in accordance with the provisionsof Section 4.08 of the General Conditions and on basis of the indicators set forth in Schedule 2, Section II. A. 1(b) of FA |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II. B. 1 | Description :Maintain a financial management system in accordance with theprovisions of Section 4.09 of the General Conditions | Due Date :04-Feb-2010

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II. B. 3 | Description :Prepare and submit to IDA audited financial statements covering theperiod of one year not later than six months after the end of the period | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Concerned government officials, DSC staff and other service providers trained on disability issues.
Disability Service Centers established and functional.
Concerned government officials, NGOs, ICPSC staff and service providers at all levels trained on child protection issues.
Number of persons with disabilities receiving services.

baseline.value: 8,168 served by 5 new disability service centers in 2009.

title.narrative: Number of children at risk receiving child protection services.

baseline.value: No integrated services available for children-at- risk

title.narrative: Performance of disability and children at risk programs regularly monitored and reviewed.

target.value: Annual conference held where monitoring reports and program results discussed

actual.value: Reports prepared in 2014 and 2016 & workshops held in 2014 and 2016 (2016 report to be finalized)

title.narrative: Share of beneficiaries that report satisfaction with services received at disability service centers.

baseline.value: 54% of beneficiaries “fully satisfied” and 43% of beneficiaries “moderately satisfied” with DSC services, equipment, staffbehaviorand competency.

title.narrative: Share of persons reporting greater awareness on related issues in communities where services have been provided.

baseline.value: • Awareness regarding PWD: 12% aggregate awareness of key government programs for PWD. • Awareness regarding children-at-risk: 9%aggregate awareness of key government programs for children-at-risk.

target.value: 20% aware of key government programs for PWD and children at risk

actual.value: 29.4% of interviewed individuals fully aware of government program including services at Disability Service Centers

title.narrative: Share of DSC staff that attain a minimum score on a technical skills assessment
Persons with disabilities receiving services via mobile outreach.

target.value: MIS operational for DSCs and ICPSCs.

actual.value: MIS operational for DSCs and ICPSCs

title.narrative: Standards for children at risk developed
